sense.name: Speak or give speech to.
sense.examples: He addressed the crowd outside the window. The chairman addressed the board of trustees. He addressed me in low tones.

sense.name: direct spoken or written message to the attention of
sense.commentary:
Syntax Is: NP1[agent] ADDRESS NP2[theme] PP{to NP[recipient]}
Note: Compare this to sense 4 "deal with". Unlike sense 4, sense 2 does not specify the nature of the object or topic (NP2) addressed by NP1. The important thing here is that some topic/object is brought to attnetion of an audience.
sense.examples: He addressed a few introductory remarks to the audience. The student body addressed a protest to the faculty senate. Counsel must address themselves only to the court. (compare to sense 3)

sense.name: Direct efforts or attention of onself.
sense.commentary: Syntax Is: NP1[agent[human]] ADDRESS ONESELF PP{to NP[patient]} Is: ADDRESS ONESELF
sense.examples: I would like to address myself to a matter which is of grave concern to me. In 1989 he addressed himself to environmental themes. The authorities must address themselves to crucial task of forging national unity.

sense.name: Deal with (something).
sense.commentary: Syntax Includes: NP1[agent] ADDRESS NP2[patient] NP1[theme] ADDRESS NP2[patient]
sense.examples: The book addressed the issue of absenteeism. We failed to address our funding problems.

sense.name: Call by correct title or proper name.
sense.commentary: Syntax Is: NP1[agent] ADDRESS NP2[patient] PP{P NP[attribute]} Includes: ADDRESS AS, ADDRESS BY
sense.examples: He likes to be addressed as 'Sir' or 'Mr Partridge'. I told you, you will address me as Great One offstage and on. You should address him by his last name.

sense.name: Write directions on mail.
sense.examples: The parcel was wrongly addressed. So why did you open a letter that was addressed to me? Address the package using the name and address listed below.

sense.name: Aim a golf ball.
sense.examples: A golfer addressed his ball to play the long first hole of the Baltusrol course.
